p: In meadows, the proportion of H. axyridis has remained low since its arrival in Switzerland ( Figure 2 and Table 2). Since H. axyridis became abundant in the region in 2008, it represented 3 to 33% of all ladybirds collected in meadows. Sixteen native species were collected, the three most abundant being Tytthaspis sedecimpunctata (L.) (41.8%), P. quatuordecimpunctata (26.6%) and Coccinella septempunctata L. (12.6%).
